title: $7 Million Verdict Blurs The Lines On Music Sampling
teaser: A jury concluded that Pharrell Williams and Robin Thicke must pay over $7 million to Marvin Gaye's heirs for copying his music. Audie Cornish asks what this mean for music in the age of sampling.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
